title: Videographer / Brand Manager
description:
**Can you film and produce high quality content for Youtube, Instagram and Tiktok?**

**Can you help manage and build a business?**

If so Crate3D is excited to hear about you. Please note - you need to submit a portfolio or links to recent work to be considered for this role. We have positions open for full time, part time and contractor.

**Job Title: Social Media Content Creator and Brand Builder**

**Company:** Crate3D LLC

**Location:** 401 Broadway, New York City

**Position Type:** Full-Time (3 days in the office + 2 work from home)

**About Us:** Crate3D LLC is a dynamic company based in the heart of New York City, specializing in a wide range of services, including 3D printing, digital design, and engineering design work. We do some large fun design projects including making props, game design and a variety of other things we are excited to start sharing with the world. We're dedicated to pushing the boundaries of creativity and innovation in the digital space. Our team of passionate professionals thrives on delivering top-notch solutions to our clients while building robust brand identities in the digital realm. Crate3D LLC is the parent company, there are a few small companies under it that you will be working directly with.

**Half of your time will be spent working directly on media (filming and editing), half will be spend doing business development and community management.**

**Job Description:**

Are you a dynamic and creative individual with a passion for content creation, branding, and community engagement? If so, we want you to join our team as a Social Media Content Creator and Brand Builder. In this role, you will be responsible for producing captivating content for our social media channels, assisting in the development of brand identities, and nurturing our online communities.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Content Creation:** Create engaging and visually appealing content (videos, images, and copy) for our social media platforms, ensuring it aligns with our brand's voice and messaging.
* **Video Production:** Film and edit high-quality videos for various social media platforms, including but not limited to TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and Facebook.
* **Brand Development:** Collaborate with the marketing team to refine and strengthen our brand identity, ensuring consistency across all digital channels.
* **Community Engagement:** Monitor and engage with our online community, responding to comments, messages, and inquiries promptly and professionally.
* **Customer Management:** Assist in managing customer inquiries, feedback, and reviews on social media, providing excellent customer service and problem-solving.
* **Trend Analysis:** Stay updated with industry trends and social media algorithms to implement effective strategies that maximize our online presence.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in content creation for social media, with a strong portfolio showcasing your work. **(Applicants MUST submit a portfolio of work or links to their recent projects.)**
* Proficiency in video production, including filming and editing using tools like Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, Photoshop or similar software.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong understanding of various social media platforms and their best practices.
* Creative thinker with a keen eye for design and aesthetics.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team.
* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple tasks efficiently.
* Knowledge of analytics and social media management tools is a plus.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* A creative and collaborative work environment.
* Opportunity for growth and professional development.
* A chance to make a meaningful impact on our brand and digital presence.
* Work with a passionate and dedicated team.

**How to Apply:**

If you are excited about the opportunity to contribute to our brand's success and have the skills and qualifications we are looking for, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume, cover letter, and a link to your portfolio showcasing your content creation work.

Crate3D LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $50,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Endodontist
description:
**About Us:**

Advanced Endodontics of New York is a prestigious specialty practice located in the heart of New York City next to Grand Central station. We pride ourselves on delivering incomparably skilled, comprehensive and gentle care that blends artistry with science. Our mission is to deliver exceptional quality care that not only addresses immediate dental concerns but also fosters lasting relationships built on trust, integrity, and a commitment to oral health.

Renowned for our commitment to delivering exceptional patient care and employing cutting-edge dental technologies, we are seeking an experienced Endodontist to join our esteemed team. If you are a skilled professional with a passion for providing top-notch endodontic care, we invite you to be a part of our dynamic practice.

**Position Overview:**

As an Endodontist at Advanced Endodontics of New York, you will be an integral part of a collaborative team committed to providing unparalleled endodontic services in the vibrant city of New York. Our practice values a patient-focused philosophy, where each individual's unique needs are met with personalized, comprehensive, and empathetic care.

We are in search of a highly skilled and experienced Endodontist to complement our team of dedicated dental professionals. The ideal candidate will bring expertise in performing complex endodontic procedures, possess excellent diagnostic abilities, and exhibit a commitment to delivering outstanding patient outcomes. This is an outstanding opportunity for an experienced Endodontist to thrive in a vibrant Endodontics specialty practice in the heart of NYC.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Entrepreneurial Mindset:**

* Take an active part in growing our practice by advertising our brand and yourself to other dentists in the area, thereby increasing referrals and patient flow to our practice which can result in substantially increasing your overall compensation.

**Clinical Excellence:**

* Perform precise and effective endodontic treatments, including root canal therapy and surgical procedures, utilizing the latest techniques and technologies.
* Uphold the highest standards of clinical quality and patient care.

**Patient-Centric Care:**

* Develop strong doctor-patient relationships through effective communication and a compassionate approach to patient care.
* Educate patients on their treatment options and encourage active participation in their oral health journey by providing expert advice.

**Collaborative Teamwork:**

* Work collaboratively with our team of skilled dental professionals, including general dentists and specialists, to provide comprehensive patient-centered care.
* Contribute to a positive and supportive work environment that values teamwork and professional growth.

**Continual Learning:**

* Stay at the forefront of endodontic advancements through ongoing professional development and participation in educational opportunities.
* Share knowledge and expertise with colleagues to enhance the collective skill set of our team.

**Qualifications:**

* Doctor of Dental Medicine (DMD) or Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS) degree from an accredited dental school.
* Completion of a postgraduate program in endodontics from an accredited institution.
* State licensure to practice as an Endodontist in New York.
* Dedication to providing patient-centered, compassionate care.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Commitment to maintaining the highest ethical and professional standards.
* Board certification or eligibility for board certification in Endodontics.

**Practice Environment:**

Advanced Endodontics of New York offers a modern and comfortable work environment equipped with state-of-the-art facilities and technology. We prioritize a healthy work-life balance and support professional development.

Join Advanced Endodontics of New York, where your expertise aligns with a philosophy centered on preserving the roots of smiles and cultivating a positive impact on the oral health of our diverse and dynamic community.

title: Clinical Supervisor - LCSW- Adult Outpatient
description:
**Compensation and Bonus Package**

75-85k Negotiable salary

35 hr work week with hybrid availability

Amazing benefits, CEUs

**Hybrid one day from home**

**About the Organization and Position**

Well known non-profit in Upper Manhattan is searching for an experienced **Clinical Supervisor** for their Adult Outpatient Services program that is in high growth mode.

This organization as a whole provides behavioral support services to the local community and is well known for their therapeutic preschool, child and adolescent programs and case management and therapeutic support for adults.

We are offering an excellent compensation package including best in class benefits for this position.

**What’s Special About this Job**

Amazing team providing cutting edge treatment, collaboration and support. Low turnover staff and employees feel supported, lots of growth opportunities!

**Responsibilities**

* Supervises and direct all activities in establishing a therapeutic environment
* Participates in the ongoing evaluation of clients and, where indicated, makes recommendations for changes in treatment schedule, changes or, facility transfers, expulsions, hospital (or other agency) referrals.
* Responsible for follow-up on all assignments to subordinate staff
* Performs one-to-one counselling with treatment participants, as necessary, on an ongoing basis, relating all data to the director.
* Assists the Program Director in overseeing the day-to-day operations of the facility, and fulfils the role of
* Supervisor in the absence of the Program Director
* Assists the Program Director with recruiting and interviewing new staff.
* Completes monthly reports for OASAS.

**Experience**

* LCSW with adult experience preferred.
* Knowledge of human behavior and psychosocial dynamics of substance abuse.
* Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
* Ability to identify and assess symptoms relating to substance abuse.
* Ability to perform under clinical and administrative pressures.
* Respects the individuality of each patient.
* Operation, planning and supervisory skills.

title: Assistant Interior Designer
description:
**Elevate Your Design Career with WA Construct: Join Us as an Assistant Interior Designer!** **Job Title: Assistant Interior Designer****Company Name: WA Construct****Salary: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year** **Full Job Description**
The Assistant Interior Designer will specialize in Kitchen, Basement, and Bathroom projects, creating functional, safe, and aesthetically pleasing spaces. This role involves evaluating space needs, strategically placing furniture, selecting decorative elements, and ensuring compliance with blueprints, building codes, and inspections. **Who we are:**
At WA Construct, we specialize in addition, remodeling, and new custom home construction, and we are growing every day. Our mission is to transform homeowners' dreams into reality. We are committed and disciplined in our pursuit to see each team member reach their personal, professional, and financial goals through our work. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process. We are Inspirational, Accountable, Responsible, Disciplined, Committed, and Aligned.  

  

  

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:*** Collaborate with clients to determine initial goals and requirements for their spaces.
* Coordinate with the project manager to understand how interior spaces should function, appear, and be furnished.
* Analyze movement and use patterns within the space.
* Prepare sketches or visual aids to demonstrate preliminary designs to clients.
* Consult with clients to select materials, furnishings, and decor.
* Use design applications to prepare and illustrate final plans.
* Determine timelines and project costs, presenting accurate estimates to clients.
* Order or obtain necessary materials, adhering to project and budget specifications.
* Oversee the installation of materials, furniture, and other design elements.
* Ensure client satisfaction by visiting the project upon completion with the client, resolving any complaints or concerns.
* Maintain current knowledge of trends, materials, techniques, and other developments in interior design.
* Build a pipeline and sell products.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

 **The ideal candidate should possess:*** Understanding the importance of repeats, referrals, and cultivating relationships.
* Interior design education, direct industry experience, or proven passion for home décor.
* Ability to proactively identify and target potential clients through effective lead generation techniques, networking, industry events, and market research.
* Natural ability to be consistently inspirational and create delightful customer and brand experiences.
* Record of sales success.
* Confidence in selling and promoting a product you might not be able to personally afford.
* Creativity, meticulous attention to detail, and a sense of craftsmanship.
* Team player with the ability to manage a portfolio of projects and clients of varying complexity in a dynamic environment.

 **EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:*** Bachelor's degree in interior designing or related equivalent of experience
* Minimum 3-5 years of experience working for interior designing.

 **PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:*** Ability to spend prolonged periods of time standing, speaking, walking, driving, and/or sitting
* Position may require travel: Up to 50%

* Professional development assistance

title: Project Manager
description:
**Lead Your Career Forward as a Project Manager at WA Construct!** **Job Title: Project Manager****Company Name: WA Construct****Salary: $75,000 - $125,000 per year** **Full Job Description**
WA Construct is seeking a dedicated and experienced Construction Project Manager to plan and oversee various construction projects from start to finish. The ideal candidate will build and manage budgets, secure necessary permits, and communicate clients' goals to subcontractors and construction workers. If you thrive in a dynamic environment and have a passion for delivering high-quality residential construction projects, we want to hear from you! **Who we are:**
At WA Construct, we specialize in addition, remodeling, and new custom home construction, and we are growing every day. Our mission is to transform homeowners' dreams into reality. We are committed and disciplined in our pursuit to see each team member reach their personal, professional, and financial goals through our work. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process. We are Inspirational, Accountable, Responsible, Disciplined, Committed, and Aligned.  

  

  

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:*** Utilize project scope to determine and define the best plan for task completion.
* Coordinate material procurement to ensure timely availability and minimize unnecessary runs.
* Manage construction schedules and activities.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant building and safety codes.
* Maintain quality execution and a clean, orderly job site.
* Anticipate problems and proactively develop solutions.
* Provide feedback to homeowners on processes, procedures, and employee performance.
* Schedule meetings with clients two weeks into the project.
* Work on weekends as needed.
* Hold bi-weekly meetings with the project salesperson.
* Daily review of subcontractor work.
* Schedule and manage town inspections and permit processes.
* Utilize a scorecard to review subcontractors.
* Follow and implement WA construction processes on all job sites.
* Keep CEO and executives updated on progress.
* Review job plans for discrepancies.
* Ensure daily site photos are sent to the executive team.
* Coordinate with suppliers for material orders.
* Monitor workmanship quality in detail, halting work when necessary to provide training.
* Communicate regularly with homeowners to keep them informed and maintain goodwill.

 **The ideal candidate should possess:*** 5-7 years in residential construction; previous Project Management experience desired.
* Minimum 1 year of leadership experience.
* Must submit Portfolio of Work
* High School Diploma or GED required.
* Ability to read and explain blueprints and floor plans.
* Proven ability to deliver projects on time and within budget.
* Strong customer satisfaction skills.
* Knowledge of industry safety practices.
* Excellent leadership and communication skills.
* Valid State Driver's License and clean driving record.
* Ability to stand, sit, walk, and lift up to 50 lbs.
* Compliance with OSHA requirements.
* Proficiency in MS Office Suite, iOS, Google Suite; BuilderTrend experience is a plus.

title: Dozer Operator
description:
**Shape Your Future: Join Tom Krutis Excavating Inc. as a Dozer Operator!** **Job Title: Dozer Operator****Company Name: Tom Krutis Excavating Inc****Salary: $70,000.00 - $93,600.00 per year** **Full Job Description**
Tom Krutis Excavating Inc. is seeking a skilled Dozer Operator to join our dedicated team. Operating 10 Ton - 25 Ton dozers (D3-D6), you will play a crucial role in executing various site development projects, ensuring precision and safety. **Who we are:**
Tom Krutis Excavating, Inc. has been providing reliable service and skilled workmanship to our valued customers for the past 40 years. With our highly trained employees and modern equipment, we ensure projects are completed on time and within budget. Servicing all of New Jersey, we specialize in a wide range of services, including excavation, grading, storm sewers, sanitary sewers, water mains, demolition, land clearing, and more. Our commitment to quality and safety sets us apart in the industry.  

  

  

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:*** Operate 10 Ton - 25 Ton dozers (D3-D6) to perform tasks such as cuts, fills, and fine grading.
* Execute fine grading for parking lots and landscape areas to meet project specifications.
* Read and interpret site plans and blueprints to understand project requirements and ensure accuracy.
* Adhere to all site safety protocols and regulations, maintaining a safe working environment.
* Perform routine maintenance and safety checks on equipment to ensure optimal performance.
* Communicate effectively with site supervisors and crew members to coordinate tasks and resolve any issues.
* Maintain a clean and organized worksite, adhering to all company and safety regulations.

 **The ideal candidate should possess:*** Proven experience operating 10 Ton - 25 Ton dozers (D3-D6).
* Extensive experience in cuts and fills, and fine grading for parking lots and landscape areas.
* Ability to read and understand site plans, blueprints, and other technical documents.
* In-depth knowledge of site safety practices and regulations.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication skills and a team-oriented attitude.
* Valid operator's license and clean driving record.
* Physical stamina and ability to work in various weather conditions.

 **Benefits:*** Medical, Dental, Visions Options
* Retirement Options
* Paid Time Off, Holidays, Vacation
* Work all Year Around
* Weekend work is rare

* Bonus Potential
* OSHA Training

* Linden, NJ, 07036

Visions Designers- Builders Inc is seeking an experienced Project Superintendent to provide on-site coordination for all phases of commercial construction projects. This role includes coordinating subcontractors, materials, and equipment, ensuring strict adherence to specifications, and maintaining schedules and budgets. The Project Superintendent will oversee scheduling, inspections, quality control, and job site safety to deliver projects successfully. **Who we are:**
Visions Designers-Builders, Inc. is a Central Long Island based General Contractor and Construction Manager. We are experienced in all types of commercial construction including educational, office, mixed use, golf club, industrial, multi-family, hospitality, residential and many other types of facilities. We provide preconstruction and construction management services, and all team members work in both aspects. We are builders at heart and truly emphasize owner satisfaction, quality, and safety on our projects. We are looking to hire excellent people who seek long-term careers and currently have many opportunities in all our divisional locations  

  

  

**Responsibilities include bu**t are not limited to:* **Scheduling:** Coordinate with the Project Manager to schedule subcontractors, consultants, and vendors in the critical path to ensure timely project completion.
* **P****roject Management:** Collaborate with project teams to budget, forecast, and manage field personnel, including labor, equipment, materials, tools, and other cost considerations.
* **Documentation:** Utilize ProCore, Outlook, and MS Excel for project management. Understand, review, and manage project plans, specifications, and manufacturer's data.
* **Quality Control:** Perform quality control duties and ensure work is performed to high standards. Communicate with project teams regarding RFIs and material submittals.
* **Subcontractor Management:** Ensure subcontractors are executing their scope of work fully and comply with safety, health, and environmental quality standards. Identify and address subcontractor non-compliance.
* **Inspections:** Coordinate required inspections with local jurisdictions and ensure timely completion.
* **Conflict Resolution:** Identify construction progress conflicts and communicate them to the project team for resolution.
* **Daily Monitoring**: Maintain a daily log of jobsite activities using ProCore Software. Walk all areas on the project multiple times daily to monitor activities and assist in future planning.
* **Meetings:** Preside over 15-minute daily subcontractor meetings to coordinate work. Manage the company's quality control program for the project.
* **Site Maintenance:** Ensure the job site is kept clean and organized. Perform job progress and completion punch list identification and completion.

 **The ideal candidate should possess:*** Strong partnership-building skills and ability to work collaboratively with others.
* Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Excellent planning and organizational skills, with attention to detail.
* Strong customer focus and ability to work with internal and external stakeholders.
* Ability to work independently, take initiative, set priorities, and complete projects.
* Demonstrated problem-solving, analytical, and decision-making skills.
* Professional appearance and demeanor, with a positive attitude and integrity.
* Social and cultural awareness and sensitivity.

 **Education and Experience:*** Bachelor's or Associate degree in Construction Management or related field, or a minimum of 5-8 years of progressive responsibility and experience managing mid- to large-sized commercial construction projects.
* Proficiency in construction software such as ProCore and mobile technologies.
* Ability to read and interpret construction plans, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.

 **Benefits:*** Medical Insurance
* 401(k)
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Holidays
* Performance or Annual Bonuses Potential
* Career Growth Opportunities
* Work Life Balance
* Company Vehicle Mileage Reimbursement

 **Schedule:*** 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

 **Work Location:*** In person
* Huntington, NY, 11743

 ***Join Visions Designers- Builders Inc and lead our construction projects to success. Apply today and be part of our commitment to excellence in commercial construction!*** *We foster a family-like environment where every employee is valued. As an equal opportunity employer, we prioritize diversity in our workforce, recognizing that innovation thrives on varied perspectives. We embrace individuals from diverse backgrounds, including ethnicity, religion, and education, without regard to race, age, gender, or sexual identity.*

title: Registered Nurse
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW:**


Provide medical care and services for clients with history of chemical dependence, including health history, physical examination, minor office procedures, treatment, referral, counseling and follow up care and services.

 **Salary range is : $48.39- $50.62/hr - This is an 1199 union job.**

 **KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Under the supervision of the Director of Nursing, act as the health coordinator for residential programs to provide services to the clients in the program.
* Review referred potential client medical histories submitted by the intake department
* Assist with referring clients to appropriate health care provider specialists.
* Provide oversight of the LPN and CNA staff
* Conduct medical assessments with all new clients
* Assist with the managing client prescriptions with various pharmacy, focusing on the agency preferred pharmacy.
* Coordinates with the client's primary care physicians to inform decisions regarding


management and treatment of problems identified and provides care as prescribed by physician.

* Manage client care: follow up plan and monitor progress, determine when referral to another


provider is necessary and plan for further care, determine when emergency room visit is necessa1y and when illness is resolved.

* Work with interdisciplinary team members regarding modification of treatment as necessary


according to health concerns.

* Provide oversight and monitoring of the wellness center to promote organized and efficient medication tracking, refills, and disposal of medication, as needed.
* Document all medications in electronic health record system, AWARDS.
* May pa1iicipate in staff meeting or professional development activities as needed.
* Assist in staffing sh01iages
* Other duties as required

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Nursing preferred from an accredited nursing program.
* Must possess an active and unrestricted license as a Registered Professional Nurse (RN) in New York State.
* Minimum of two (2) years of related experience in health care facility.
* Must possess current Basic Life Support (BLS) certification.
* Must possess current NYS approved Infection Control certification (4.0 hours, valid for 4 years).
* Must have specific training in chemical use, abuse and dependence specific to the services provided.
* Must obtain Mandated reporter (2 hours) prior to hire date.


o Website info: https://nysmandatedreporter.org/TrainingCourses.aspx

* Obtain within six months of hire:


o Suppo11ing Recovery with Medications Addiction Treatment (MAT)


o CASAC Canon of Ethics (6 hours)


o Confidentiality related *to* 42CFR (3 hours)

* Knowledge of substance/alcohol dependence/abuse population.
* Specialty Area may include but not limited to Family Health, Women's Health, Holistic Care, etc.

Job Type: Full-time


Salary: $48.39- $50.62/hr

title: Dentist
description:
The **Dentist** will examine, diagnose, and treat diseases, injuries, and malformations of teeth and gums.
he/she will treat diseases of nerve, pulp, and other dental tissues affecting oral hygiene and retention of
 teeth. May fit dental appliances or provide preventive care. This position includes managerial or
supervisory responsibilities. **Pays $135,000-$145,000 per year****KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:*** Administer anesthetics to limit the amount of pain experienced by patients during procedures.
* Use masks, gloves and safety glasses to protect themselves and their patients from infectious diseases.
* Examine teeth, gums, and related tissues, using dental instruments, x-rays, or other diagnostic equipment, to evaluate dental health, diagnose diseases or abnormalities, and plan appropriate treatments.
* Formulate plan of treatment for patient's teeth and mouth tissue.
* Use air turbine and hand instruments, dental appliances and surgical implements.
* Diagnose and treat diseases, injuries, or malformations of teeth, gums, or related oral structures and provide preventive or corrective services.
* Advise or instruct patients regarding preventive dental care, the causes and treatment of dental problems, or oral health care services.
* Treat exposure of pulp by pulp capping, removal of pulp from pulp chamber, or root canal, using dental instruments.
* Write prescriptions for antibiotics or other medications.
* Design, make, or fit prosthodontics appliances, such as space maintainers, bridges, or dentures, or write fabrication instructions or prescriptions for denturists or dental technicians.
* Fill pulp chamber and canal with endodontic materials.
* Remove diseased tissue, using surgical instruments.

**REQUIREMENTS:*** Doctoral degree in dental medicine or dental surgery
* 3 + years of related experience

title: Case Manager (CCBHC)
description:
The **Case Manage**r provides supports the wellness and recovery goals of individuals with complex and/or chronic behavioral health and substance abuse issues and needs by implementing targeted interventions designed to provide timely, high-quality, and efficient care. Targeted Case Management services are tailored around goals aimed at providing services that encourage individuals to resolve problems that interfere with their attainment or maintenance of independence or self-sufficiency.


The Case manager must have knowledge of community resources and counseling/social work practices with high-risk populations. The Case Manager must have experience working with persons in crisis while attaining the ability to work independently with a strong sense of focus. Must be task-oriented, nonjudgmental and maintain boundary with individuals. The case manager must be able to work in a variety of settings with culturally diverse families while having the ability to be culturally sensitive and appropriate. Maintain a caseload and meet with patients on a weekly basis. The goal of the case manager is to help patients regain optimum health or improve functional capability, in the right setting. It involves assessments, comprehensive diagnostic and treatment planning evaluation to achieve wellness and recovery goals. Case managers are the cohort in accessing services via referral, linkage to needed services, and monitoring follow up on patient care in order to meet the individual's needs. **Pays: 35,000/YEARLY**

 **KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Provide targeted case management services to children, youth and adult consumers living with mental health illnesses and substance abuse disorders and their families/support systems through ensuring access to care, engagement in care coordination of care to obtain the full range of needed services.
* Gather enrollment consents, PSYCKES/RHIO consents, and complete screening, baseline-risk assessments, reassessments, plan of care, plan of care updates and notes in accordance with departmental policies.
* Demonstrate the ability to clearly articulate, verbally and in writing, the aims and goals of the department to potential patients, community members and staff.
* Participate in quality improvement activities, projects and reviews in collaboration clinical team members.
* Complete daily, weekly, monthly, or other periodic requests for narrative or quantitative data reports for program review
* Prioritize the homeless population through identification of new sources of potential patients, onsite meetings with patients at their shelter and conduct outreach and engagement presentations.
* Meet regularly with supervisor and attend staff meetings and case conferences. Be prepared to discuss case management and operational issues impacting performance and program operations.
* Complete and submit daily activity log in accordance with departmental policies.
* Ensure patient is attending scheduled medical and social service visits through building relationships with patients and providers. Coordinate and schedule appointments with Social Worker and Medical/Mental Health providers. Routine calls should be made to internal and external providers before and after visits to follow up and provide necessary support to the patients.
* At a minimum, maintain four contacts with each client or at a greater frequency as indicated by the risk stratification and plan of care.
* Access and respond per agency guidelines to client complaints of grievances
* Conduct outreach and engagement in accordance with policies via phone, electronic methods, and letter and or field work to client/collateral/provider to engage clients or strengthen connectivity.
* Help maintain health and wellness and prevent secondary disease complications through provision of health information, support plan of care, and coaching.
* Promote and expand linkage development in all areas related to patient care including social determinants (e.g. housing, employment) and monitor the effectiveness of linkages with other service providers via phone, face to face meetings of formal case conferences.
* Communicate effectively with Supervisor in identifying strengths, weakness and opportunities of program operations
* Ensure community-follow up to engage the client in care; promote compliance with medical appointments and encourages client self-sufficiency and empowerment.
* Identify and attend training for professional development and attend departmental in-service meetings as required
* Must complete Integrated Mental Health/Addictions Treatment Training (IMHATT) Certificate
* Must be trained in Trauma Informed Care and in Military and Veteran's culture
**REQUIREMENTS:**

* High School Diploma or GED required.
* Associate Degree and Bachelor's degree preferred.
* Minimum of six (6) years of experience in case management.
* Must obtain Mandated reporter (2 hours) training/certificate required.

o Website info: https://nysmandatedreporter.org/TrainingCourses.aspx

* Must complete Integrated Mental Health/Addictions Treatment Training (IMHATT) Certificate within **three (3) months of hire date.**
* Must be team oriented and possess a positive attitude with a willingness to be flexible and helpful.
* Must be able to multi-task with strong organizational skills.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and able to communicate both verbally and in written form.
* Commitment to cultural diversity and sensitivity.
* Ability to maintain a professional demeanor under pressure and operate with keen sense of urgency and commitment to quality.

Job Type: Full-time


Salary: $35,000.00 per year


Benefits:

  

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance
  

Schedule:

  

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* On call
  

Ability to commute/relocate:

  

* Brooklyn, NY 11231: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
  

Education:

  

* High school or equivalent (Required)
  

Language:

  

* Spanish (Preferred)
  

License/Certification:

  

* Mandated reporter certificate (Required)

title: Residential Aide (Bronx)
description:
Acacia Network, the leading Latino integrated care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing and community building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we"ve been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland and Puerto Rico.

We are seeking Residential aides for our Transitional Housing Single Female shelter located in the Bronx. The Residential Aide will be the primary connection between the operations staff and the clients. The residential aide will spend a large amount of time with the residents. They will spend this time helping client who need more hands on assistance. They will also provide insight to the current atmosphere in the facility and what are the current client complaints or recommendations. **Salary $16-$21/HR**
**Responsibilities consist of but not limited to:*** Perform Daily room and bed inspections
* Pack up and log items for AWOL residents
* Escort client to appointments
* Assist in the monitoring and development of resident"s independent living skills
* Monitor and track furniture
* Perform nightly bed counts
* Fill in for kitchen staff when necessary
* Conflict resolution between residents
* Cover operations desk when necessary
* Answer phones when necessary
* Help maintain the cleanliness of the building
* Monitor common areas to ensure proper usage

**Education/ License:*** High School Diploma or GED required. Associates Degree preferred
* Food handlers certificate a plus

**Qualifications:*** 2 years of applicable experience in shelter or residential setting
* Passion for working with individuals and families who are in transitional housing
* Excellent communication skills, comfortable working with others
* Ability to maintain accurate records, to prepare and submit all required paperwork in a timely and accurate manner
* Knowledge of DHS requirements and protocols
* Ability to deal with sensitive issues with diplomacy and discretion
* Must be able to multi task with strong organizational skills
* Bilingual is a plus

**Benefits:*** We offer to the chosen candidate a generous compensation package!

title: Certified Recovery Peer Advocate (Queens)
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW:**


The OASAS **Certified Recovery Peer Advocate** requires someone who is culturally aware and sensitive to the needs of the targeted population, possess excellent computer skills, be able to function as a part of a multidisciplinary team and understand therapy and group work rooted in evidenced based approaches for intervention and management strategies. Certified Recovery Peer Advocate services are peer-delivered services with a rehabilitation and recovery focus. They are designed to promote skills for coping with and managing behavioral health symptoms while facilitating the utilization of natural resources and the enhancement of recovery-oriented principles (e.g., hope and self-efficacy, and community living skills). Certified Recovery Peer Advocate support uses trauma-informed, non-clinical assistance to achieve long-term recovery from a behavioral health disorder.


Under supervision of the Program Director or designee, the requirements listed below represent the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. The provider ensures strengths based, person centered quality of care provided in a culturally and linguistically meaningful therapeutic environment. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities as defined by the ADA to perform the essential functions of the job. The functions below outline the general responsibilities associated with this position. Each of these functions is considered critical to effective department operations and our Mission. It is expected that all staff in this position will have satisfactory attendance and will perform these functions as assigned in a competent, cooperative, and timely manner. The Job Description will be reviewed periodically for accuracy and/or adjusted according to business necessity. Pays:$45,000 per year

**KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

+ Help promote skills for coping and managing behavioral health symptoms.
+ Educates clients about Medication Assisted Treatments (MAT), prevention, harm reduction, and Narcan.
+ Work as a member of multidisciplinary treatment team that practices client centered and holistic care.
+ Accompany clients to appointments and complete warm handoff referrals to SUD.
+ Communicate effectively with clients and collateral contacts.
+ Conduct outreach for care coordination.
+ Assist in the selection and utilization of self-directed recovery tools such as relapse prevention planning.
+ Connect individuals to self-help groups in the community.
+ Provide recovery education and counseling to individuals.
+ Provide preventative and crisis support services.
+ Conduct support groups to strengthen social skills, decrease isolation, provide emotional support, and create opportunities for ongoing natural support.
+ Participate in staff and organizational meetings as requested for care coordination.
+ Maintain compliance with all organizational policies and procedures.
+ Complete wellness and health promotions activities.
+ Follow-up with the individual to confirm linkage to Care Coordination, outpatient treatment or other community services.
+ Perform additional relevant duties as requested by supervisor/management.
+ Completes care plans, progress notes, data reports and other documentation as required.
+ Works off site at shelter location(s) as assigned in the metro area.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

+ Hold a high school diploma or high school equivalency.
+ Bi-lingual (Spanish/English); strongly preferred.
+ NYS Certified Recovery Peer Advocate certification is required. Provisional certification accepted.

* will be accepted within 12 months to obtain full certification.
+ Must obtain Mandated reporter (2 hours) prior to hire date.
+ Website info: https://nysmandatedreporter.org/TrainingCourses.aspx
+ Obtain within thirty days of hire:

* o Screening, Brief Intervention and Referral to Treatment
* o CRPA Canon of Ethics (6 hours)
* o Confidentiality related to 42CFR (3 Hours)
+ Must be trained in Trauma Informed Care and in Military and Veteran's culture, or complete training within 1 month of employment.

+ Positive attitude and professional demeanor.
+ Ability to complete work independently as well as in collaboration with team members.

+ Highly organized, motivated self-starter.
+ Excellent time management skills.

description:
Under supervision of the Program Director, the **Resident Monitor** is responsible for providing after hours coverage, support, and crisis intervention to tenants/guests/staff at Mosholu Gardens. The requirements listed below represent the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities as defined by the ADA to perform the essential functions of the job. **The salary is $40K/Year.****KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:*** Ensure the safety of the facility and the tenants
* ensure tenants are in basic adherence with Rules and Regulations, provide mild interventions, keep staff up to date to provide higher level interventions
* Provide all tenant information and daily report logs requested in a timely and accurate manner
* Ensure facilities are maintained and repairs are followed up with to create a positive environment of care. This includes ensuring the staff areas and common areas are cleaned and organized and trash is emptied. Work orders to be forwarded to appropriate persons
* Monitor the facilities, staff and tenants to ensure that all after hours operations are within the Acacia expectations, regulations and contractual obligations
* Provide on-site crisis intervention
* Maintains appropriate documentation of all tenants contacts in log
* Handle special assignments, duties and functions as assigned
* House Runs - regular presence in the lobby and on the residential floors
* Maintains notes on approved tenant meetings held in conference room after hours
* Assist tenants with laundry, shopping, appointments, if needed and directed by supervisor
* Ensure laundry room is closed/opened at appropriate hours
* Acts as liaison between participants, superintendents and building managers to ensure all emergency repairs are reported
* Maintains a Resident Monitor Log, which includes tenant/guest activity and facility observations
* Reports all non-compliance issues with respect to the tenants, guests, apartments and building to the Supportive Housing Manager or On-Call Staff, including incidents requiring immediate attention

**REQUIREMENTS:*** The shifts are 4-12am and 12-8am
* High School Diploma/GED required, Associates Degree preferred
* Bi-lingual (English/Spanish), preferred
* Two (2+) years previous relevant experience in a Mental or Behavioral Health environment Preferred.
* Ability to use business acumen to exercise good judgment and decision-making
* Ability to deal with sensitive issues with diplomacy and discretion
* Must be able to multi task with strong organizational skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills and able to communicate both verbally and in written form
* Commitment to cultural diversity and sensitivity
* Ability to maintain a professional demeanor under pressure, and operate with a keen sense of urgency and commitment to quality

title: After School Program Group Leaders (Bronx and Manhattan)
description:
Acacia Network, the leading Latino integrated care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing and community building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we've been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland and Puerto Rico.

We are currently accepting applications for the upcoming 2022-2023 school year for **Part Time Group Leaders**. As a member of ACDP's after school program, your mission will be to provide quality academic enrichment, recreation, and youth development to students between 5-13. The ideal candidate will have the ability to perform under pressure and possess a professional demeanor. **Pay $15 per hour**  

**Responsibilities consist of but not limited to:*** Provide educational and recreational enrichment to students.
* Conducts homework-help, tutoring, etc.
* Ensures that all activities are held with safety as a top priority.
* Providing careful and effective supervision of children's activities
* Taking attendance, headcounts, and monitoring program activities
* Promoting a safe, fun and enriching environment for students.
* Coordinating activities and field trips for groups.
* Creating lesson plans and carrying out program activities.
* Setting up, breaking down, and cleaning up program area.
 **Qualifications:*** Fully Vaccinated against Covid-19
* High School Diploma or GED Required. Bachelor's Degree preferred
* Must have at least 1 year of previous experience working with school-aged children
* Must have skills and abilities in at least one of the following areas: music, sports, science, math, art, step dance, singing, chess, dancing.
* Understand DOH, DYCD, and DOE regulations in an after school setting
* Have a passion for providing youth with the tools they need to be successful
* Able to communicate effectively with parents, students, and faculty
* Must have availability to work Monday through Friday for the school year, between the hours of 2:00pm to 6:00 pm.

title: Client Care Coordinator (LMSW or LMHC)
description:
Acacia Network, the leading Latino integrated care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing and community building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we"ve been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland and Puerto Rico.
  

We are seeking **Client Care Coordinators/Social Workers** in NYC, who will be responsible for coordinating all services related to the mental health issues of clients, including diagnoses, assessment of need and referral as warranted. He/She will provide therapy for clients with special needs and conduct special focus groups for clients (e.g., post-traumatic stress, sexual or other abuse, etc.) The Social Worker will conduct the initial psychosocial history and mental health care upon completion of inpatient program. **The salary is $55-57K**
**Responsibilities consist of but not limited to:*** Conduct initial psychosocial history interviews on al clients during the Admission/Orientation phase
* Conduct mental health status determination during Admission/Orientation Phase and at other appropriate times during the Treatment Phases
* Coordinate all mental health treatment and referrals for clients in all phases
* Consult with primary counselors on clients with special needs
* Provide supervision or treatment of all cases requiring social worker level involvement by managed care or other referrals agencies
* Attends seminars and training on pertinent issues
* Develop and maintain referral linkages with outside agencies and organizations to meet the needs of program clients
* Participate on interdisciplinary treatment teams and in case conferences
* Maintain up to date case notes for clients on caseload
* Work in close liaison with program Nurse Practitioner-Psychiatrist

**Education/ License:*** Masters of Social Work from an accredited institution required
* NYS Licensed LMSW or LMHC

**Qualifications:*** 2 years post graduate experience providing social work services, preferable serving chemically dependent and/or mentally ill individuals
* Previous relevant experience in delivering social services in a DHS regulations shelter environment
* Knowledge of DHS policies, procedures, and protocols
* Ability to deal with sensitive issues with diplomacy and discretion
* Ability to use business acumen to exercise good judgment and decision-making
* Experience working with Microsoft Office
* Bilingual is a plus

**Benefits:**

We offer to the chosen candidate a generous compensation package!

title: Education Specialist
description:
**Education Specialist- Job Description**
The Education Specialist, along with the Program Director and Assistant Site Director and Education Director is responsible for coordinating educational activities and developing curriculum and reviewing lesson plans. Education Specialists will assist the Activity Instructors, group leaders in program activities and assure that the homework help component for the program runs effectively and smoothly. The Education Specialist also provides training for staff. Instruction and activities designed to promote subject mastery, develop grade-level competencies, and teach study skills. The Education Specialist will also be responsible for creating a safe and positive environment, to provide opportunities for learning, interaction, and academic / personal growth. The Educational Specialist will also assist in the reviewing, writing and creation of lesson plans. The incumbent will be responsible for planning, organizing, and leading groups of assigned participants in a variety of educational enhancement activities in the areas of Career, work, literacy, and leadership which will teach skills and help to improve overall personal and academic performance. The Education Specialist works 9-hours per week, supporting the teaching staff in developing strong lessons and integrating DYCD frameworks for Literacy, Leadership, and STEM. **Hourly Rate $45.00****Key** **Essential Functions:*** Supports the implementation of program curriculum and work with program staff to develop sequential learning goals and objectives for all activities
* Ensures the integration of literacy and STEM-based learning and enrichment through sequenced, curriculum-based programming
* Provide coaching and modelling and ensures that implementation of program activities aligns with demonstrated best practices
* Facilitates professional development trainings and workshops for frontline staff
* Researches best practices in afterschool programming and brings new ideas to program staff
* Identifies and develops supplementary resources to support students' learning and interests
* Meet development and academic standards for instruction.
* tutoring, mentoring and coaching demonstrate competence in analyzing students' needs.
* Assist participants in actively achieving an increased comprehension and retention of specific subject material, and improved academic skill in designated areas.
* Help participants develop necessary skills for academic success.
* Actively participate in PD training sessions, designated meetings, and special events, as appropriate.
* Attends and Assist in organization of required meetings and staff development workshops.
**Requirement****s****:*** Master's Degree in education or other related area preferred. Bachelors required.or a related field Preferred
* Minimum of two years' teaching experience
* Knowledge of NYS common core learning standards
* Experience in developing and reviewing STEM curriculum, lesson plans, experience coaching teachers and/or facilitators preferred in school day or afterschool setting.
* Exceptional group management, problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Experience working with children from diverse background Possess an understanding and knowledge of public school functions, Common Core, and specific knowledge in age-appropriate teachings and curriculum.
* General knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Knowledge of Access, Adobe PageMaker and Photoshop preferred.
* Knowledge of DYCD, DOE, and DOH mandates

title: Substance Abuse Counselor Transitional Housing( Brooklyn)
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW:**


The Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC) provides alcoholism and substance abuse counseling services at designed shelter location(s). The CASAC utilizes holistic comprehensive assessment techniques to determine appropriate treatment needs and levels of care for clients. This includes performing diagnostic assessment, evaluation, intervention, referral, and alcoholism and/or substance abuse counseling in both individual and group settings when deemed appropriate. Participates as a member of the multidisciplinary team in the provision of client care. **The salary is $65K/Year**

**KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Works within the shelter system to engage the client population in receiving substance abuse education, prevention, and treatment services.
* Educates clients on 'stages of change' and meets clients where they are at in the process.
* Educates client on different levels of SUD treatment modalities including inpatient, outpatient, detox, rehab, short/long term care, prevention, and harm reduction care.
* Introduces clients to Medication Assisted Treatment (MAT).
* Completes comprehensive clinical assessments for all client encounters.
* Assist clients in the admission process that is deemed appropriate for their level of treatment services.
* Engages client in creating a Recovery Plan and/or Safety Plan to reduce high risk drug.
* Educates clients on client obligations, client rights and services.
* Documents all individual, groups, and/or crisis interventions counseling plus any other significant contact in the client's clinical record.
* Documents techniques used during individual counseling sessions and group therapy to address behaviors, attitudes, and feelings.
* Provides ongoing direct services to clients, helping them with adjustments problems, referrals, substance abuse counseling, etc.
* Facilitate educational groups, workshops and events on SUD, MAT alternatives, Harm Reduction, and the use of Narcan.
* Participates as a member of the multidisciplinary team and maintains ongoing cooperative relationship with other disciplines to assure quality client services.
* Provides in-community services as specified by OASAS regulations.
* Maintain and updates referral service and resources that may be useful to this client population.
* Participates in clinical supervision as schedule.
* Completes daily progress notes and encounters.
* Monitors and tracks clients through identified database.
* Inputs client information in required database.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* High School Diploma required. Associate/Bachelor Degree preferred
* Valid unrestricted OASAS certification as a CASAC. (No CASAC-T)
* Must have specific training in chemical use, abuse, and dependence specific to the services provided.
* Obtain within thirty days of hire:


o Supporting Recovery with Medications Addictions Treatment (MAT)


o Screening, Brief Intervention and Referral to Treatment


o CASAC Canon of Ethics (6 hours)


o Confidentiality related to 42CFR (3 Hours)


o Mandated reporter (2 hours)

* 3+ years' experience in OASAS program.
* Strong leadership, excellent organizational and communication skills.
* Ability to work on a strong team of professionals in a culturally diverse environment.
* Ability to multitask and to work and function under pressure.
  

\\*Acacia Network is an equal opportunity employer\\*

title: Youth Counselor

Produce weekly programmatic reports on work sites' concerns and issues. Attend department meetings, as needed. Collect all SYEP relevant documents (e.g. timesheets, evaluations, ISS forms).

**The salary for the Youth Counselor** **is $15.20 - $20/per hour based on relevant experience.**

* Collection of timesheets on a weekly basis and ensure completion with accuracy.
* Cooperate and maintain a working relationship with the assigned worksite supervisors.
* Communicate with the Program Manager regarding any conflicts with worksite assignments.
* Maintain participant files, timesheets and evaluations.
* Attend all related meetings, trainings and supervisions as required. To perform this job successfully, the candidate must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Perform other duties as assigned.

**EDUCATION AND REQUIREMENTS:**

* **High School Diploma or High School Equivalency with 2 year's work related experience related to customer service and administrative duties** ***(Bachelors Degree preferred)***
* Effective communications skills, both oral and written form
* Excellent organizational skills essential to maintain accurate records
* Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines
* Interact professionally with participants, staff, clients and community partners in a professional manner
* Work collaboratively with other team members to meet common goals
* Sensitivity and awareness to different cultures
* Conduct himself/herself as a professional as per policy on conduct, appearance and adherence to the overall organizational policy
* *Bilingual (Spanish speaking) preferred*
* Proficient Microsoft Office Suite computer knowledge (Excel, PowerPoint)
* *Experience working with Youth Development Services a plus*

**About Us:** Acacia Network, the leading Latino integration care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, and great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing, and community-building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we've been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland, and Puerto Rico.

title: Program Director (MICA Shelter)
description:
Under supervision of the Program Administration, the **Program Director** ensures quality care and oversees the functions of the 200 bed MICA population shelter according to DHS regulatory and accreditation requirements. This individual is responsible for the oversight and implementation of care and resources for the purpose of meeting the physical, emotional and social needs of clients. The **Program Director** provides supervision to the intake services and works with the Director of Client/Social Services to develop, implement, track, report, and evaluate measurable outcomes. The requirement listed below represent the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities as defined by the ADA to perform the essential functions of the job. **The salary range is $75-90K**

**KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

+ Responsible for overseeing all aspects of the site's operation - service delivery, compliance to contracts, target (*case management, employment, housing placements, medical and chart compliance, recreational activities, security, maintenance, food service if applicable, etc*.)
+ Provide leadership, guidance, direction, and supervision to all staff to ensure accurate and timely completion of deliverables, targets and benchmark.
+ Interview, hire, supervise, and set up training to program personnel to reach program goals
+ Conduct performance evaluations, disciplinary actions, resignations, and terminations.
+ Monitor and maintain the fiscal condition of the program
+ Develop program content to address clients' needs related to ADL, Time Management, Critical Thinking, shelter rules and regulations
+ Ensure and maintain all regulatory agency (*i.e. Dept. of Health, OTDA, DHS, Coalition for the Homeless*) standards are in compliance (*related to food and emergency supplies, linen, personal belongings, client mail, laundry, personal care items, etc.)*
+ Understand all aspects of contract requirements and communicate this understanding to staff
+ Responsible for the overall administration of the site, food service, procurement of equipment and supplies for program and staff
+ Plan interpret all policies and procedures for staff; ensure implementation of all policies and procedures
+ Plan and organize program activities to maximize program contact's goals and performance targets as outlined
+ Plan, coordinate and facilitate social/peer support and ADL events
+ Communicate with peers at other Acacia Network Shelters on issues related to client progress and best practices
+ Facilitate interdepartmental communication and conduct regular staff/departmental meetings
+ Set realistic weekly and monthly performance goals in accordance with contract requirement with reporting staff
+ Ensure accurate and timely reporting and statistical information for both Acacia Network management and regulatory agencies
+ Review the analysis of program and demographic client data to make programming improvements
+ Contact Food vendors and/or sub-contractors to ensure appropriate service deliveries and quality
+ Connect with community to build connections, gain support and troubleshoot issues/concerns
+ Conduct periodic internal file review and implement Quality Assurance measures as needed to ensure quality service delivery to clients (*i.e. - address and investigate client complaints*)
+ Organize onsite and offsite training opportunities for professional development of staff
+ Develop and implement crisis prevention and/or intervention strategies to ensure a safe and secure environment
+ Troubleshoot client and direct reporting staff programs. And make decisions in accordance with program policies, procedures, and protocols
+ Provide assistance and follow-up in regards to critical incidents with clients
+ Conduct and document one-on-one supervision of direct reporting staff to asses and improve work performance (i.e. identify training needs, professional development, etc.)
+ Serve as the Incident Commander for the entire facility
+ Report all incidents that may subject Acacia Network to liability to the Program Director
+ Review and sign all time sheets
+ Tasks may be modified, expanded and/or assigned over time

**REQUIREMENTS:**

+ Bachelor Degree in Social Work or related field, required
+ Master Degree in Social Work, preferred
+ Valid New York State LMSW, LCSW, or LMHC preferred
+ **Seven (7+) years of experience with homeless population or special needs population (mental illness, substance abuse, HIV, etc.)**
+ **Five (5+) years must be in a managerial position**
+ Experience working with individuals and/or families facing homeless
+ Experience in staff training and development
+ An understanding of funding and industry regulations and a track record of meeting compliance standards
+ Strong leadership, excellent organizational and communication skills
+ Ability to work on a strong team of professionals in a culturally diverse environment
+ Ability to multitask and to work and function under pressure

  

\\*Acacia Network is an equal opportunity employer\\*

title: Intake Specialist, CASAC-T
description:
The **Intake Specialist** is responsible for wide range of case management duties assisting applicants and referents to Greenhope's residential program. Responsible for outreach and coordinating referrals, and completing the admission process for new clients, in accordance with program regulations. **Salary:$41,787.82**

**KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Primary liaison with internal and external referral sources for residential services.
* Maintains a stream of referrals to ensure residential beds are filled on a weekly basis.
* Complete preliminary telephone or face-to-face screening to determine eligibility for services as delineated by contractual requirements via electronic health record system. Conducts screening interview and complete LOCADTR and other assessment documents. Obtain detailed demographic information on client criminal, family, substance, mental health and other relevant data.
* Answers all inquiries from potential program clients, returning all calls within 24-48 hours.
* Maintain a calendar noting work schedule to be shared with managers, receptionist, outreach staff and program managers.
* Help to develop partnerships and linkages with all referral sources (hospitals, community agencies, crisis system, corrections, family, and other community partners) via phone and letters. Schedule recruitment activities for outreach staff. Input new and updated referral sources in Electronic Health Record system (NextGen).
* Receives and coordinates all referrals to include notification of insurance providers for prior authorization and services covered. Coordinate with the Benefits department to ensure client financial status via Medicaid and other managed care funding source. May need to review financial information as needed to determine ability to pay for services.
* Along with department manager, maintains all program waiting lists, admissions, discharges and updates all lists on an on-going basis. Maintains weekly/monthly contact with referring case managers and other providers.
* Conduct induction process with residential clients and deliver to primary counselor. Coordinate with department manager to have active list of primary counselor assignments.
* Distribute email notification of pending admission and actual admission report in a timely manner to include chart number, name, children and any other pertinent documents.
* As needed, participate in clinical staff meetings and case conferences as necessary to ensure good coordination and continuity of care.
* Receive regular weekly supervision from Department Manager.
* Other duties as provided by supervisor

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* The competitive candidate will have bachelor's degree or higher in the social sciences or relevant field. A minimum of one-year experience in assessment process.
* Must have a **CASAC-T** or be a qualified health professional.
* Knowledge of DSM-IV diagnoses, substance abuse, and recovery
* Knowledge of state and local behavioral health and related services
* Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing
* Ability to work independently and with others and on a team
* Ability to maintain confidentiality of information
* Ability to work under pressure and handle issues which develop unexpectedly

Job Type: Full-time


Salary: $41,788.00 per year


Medical specialties:

  

* Addiction Medicine

  

Schedule:

  

* Monday to Friday

* New York, NY 10035: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

* High school or equivalent (Required)

title: Assistant Program Director
description:
The general responsibilities of the **Assistant Program Director** are to assist the Program Director  

with the overall planning, coordination, supervision and implementation of projects and  

departmental activities serving youth in school based program. Ability to supervise, assist in  

monitoring staff. Understanding the scope and design of youth development and School time  

programming in academic based program. **The salary is $40,000/Year.**  

**KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**  

* Serves in an advisory capacity to the Program/Department Director
* Assists with the planning, directing, supervising, and coordination of diverse and


comprehensive planning, evaluation and research activities.  

* Assists with the preparation and monitoring of a diverse operations budget and applies and


observes appropriate fiscal controls; interprets and applies appropriate laws, codes, rules  

and policies.  

* Assists with directing and conducting complex analyses of organizational and


administrative problems.  

* Assists with recommending and implementing effective courses of action.
* Assists with planning and managing the use of automated systems to meet the


requirements of internal and external projects and operations

planning process; and assists with planning, directing, supervising, and coordinating  

diverse and comprehensive policy analyses and development activities.

leadership and supervision.

creativity

supervisory staff.

title: Program Director
description:
The Program Director oversees the coordination and administration of all aspects of an ongoing program including planning, organizing, staffing, leading, and controlling program activities. Directs and oversees all staff and activities at the program site including but not limited to the supervision of children (K-5), supervision and evaluation of program staff, payroll reporting, communication with parents, record keeping Financial billing(Accounting), ordering and inventory maintenance, and staff training and development.
 The salary range is $52K-$55K/Annually **KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTION****S****:** ***Program Planning**** Plan the delivery of the overall program and its activities in accordance with the mission and the goals of the organization.
* Develop new initiatives to support the strategic direction of the organization.
* Develop and implement long-term goals and objectives to achieve the successful outcome of the program.
* Develop an annual budget and operating plan to support the program.
* Develop a program evaluation framework to assess the strengths of the program and to identify areas for improvement.
* Develop funding proposals for the program to ensure the continuous delivery of services.
***Program Organization**** Ensure that program activities operate within the policies and procedures of the organization.
* Ensure that program activities comply with all relevant legislation and professional standards.
* Develop forms and records to document program activities.
* Oversee the collection and maintenance of records on the clients of the program for statistical purposes according to the confidentiality/privacy policy of the organization.
***Program Staffing**** In consultation with the Executive Director to recruit, interview and select well-qualified program staff.
* Ensure that personnel files for the program are properly maintained and kept confidential.
* Establish and implement a performance management process for all program staff.
* Engage volunteers for appropriate program activities using established volunteer management practices.
* Ensure that all staff receive an appropriate orientation of the organization.
***Program Leadership**** Ensure all staff members receive orientation and appropriate training in accordance with organizational standards.
* Supervise program staff by providing direction, input, and feedback.
* Communicate with clients and other stakeholders to gain community support for the program and to solicit input to improve the program.
* Liaise with other managers to ensure effective and efficient program delivery.
* Coordinate the delivery of services among different program activities to increase effectiveness and efficiency.
***Additional Responsibilities**** Write reports on the program for management and for funders.
* Communicate with funders as outlined in funding agreements.
* Ensure that the program operates within the approved budget.
* Monitor and approve all budgeted program expenditures.
* Monitor cash flow projections and report actual cash flow and variance to the Executive Director on a regular basis (monthly/bimonthly)
* Manage all project funds according to established accounting policies and procedures.
* Ensure that all financial records for the program are up to date
* Ensure financial reports and supporting documentation for funders are prepared as outlined in funding agreements.
* Provide the required information to have invoices generated and submitted to funders according to the established timelines.
* Identify and evaluate the risks associated with program activities and take appropriate action to control the risks.
* Monitor the program activities on a regular basis and conduct an annual evaluation according to the program evaluation framework.
* Report evaluation findings to the Executive Director and recommend changes to enhance the program, as appropriate.
**Requirements*** Bachelor's Degree in Education Preferred (other acceptable fields include recreation, social work, program administration, psychology and sociology).
* 1-2 years of experience in program administration or involving academic, instructional or counseling activities.
* Ability to plan, coordinate and implement a variety of program activities and events.
* Knowledge of program management.
* Bilingual – Spanish strongly preferred.

title: Housing Specialist
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW:**  

 Under supervision of the Program Director, the Housing Specialist is responsible for providing housing case management and support to consumers and completing reporting requirements. The requirements listed below represent the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to successfully fulfill the position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities as defined by the ADA to perform the essential functions of the job. Pays:$55,000 per year **KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:*** Provides housing case management and on-site crisis intervention, as needed.
* Completes housing items for required service plans.
* Acts as liaison between consumers, superintendents, and building managers to ensure all repairs are completed to either the participant's apartment unit or the building.
* Maintains a Building and Apartment Log for where consumers are living, which includes date, and condition of the apartments and buildings.
* Reports all non-compliance issues with respect to the apartment and building to the Supportive Housing Manager, including incidents requiring immediate attention.
* Educates consumers with respect to good housekeeping and home-safety practices, budgeting and landlord/tenant relations, as necessary.
* Maintains appropriate documentation of all consumer contacts and progress notes.
* Conducts home visits to help evaluate consumers' compliance with the rules and regulations of the housing program they are enrolled in (if appropriate) and to assess the need for referral to supportive services to ensure they maintain stable housing.
* May escort participants to social services agencies, as requested.
* Completes annual tenant rent calculation forms as well as apartment inspection forms to ensure consumers can maintain housing.
* Ensures annual leases are updated and filed.

 **EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:*** Associate's Degree or an equivalent related field required, Bachelor's preferred
* 2+ years previous relevant experience in a Behavioral Health environment required
* Ability to use business acumen to exercise good judgment and decision-making
* Ability to deal with sensitive issues with diplomacy and discretion
* Must be able to multi-task with strong organizational skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills and able to communicate both verbally and in written form
* Commitment to cultural diversity and sensitivity
* Bilingual in English/Spanish a plus
